content.description: A planet has two moons, Moon <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and Moon <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, that orbit at different distances from the planet’s center, as shown. Astronomers collect data regarding the planet, the two moons, and their obits. The astronomers are able to estimate the planet’s radius and mass.
content.question: What additional information is needed to determine the time required for one of the moons to make one complete revolution around the planet?

choices.label: The distance between the center of each moon and the planet.

content.answer: The distance between the center of each moon and the planet.
